comment: Works on Android smartphone and tablet (4.2, 4.4). Shows more info than any of my machines' OS software does.   Would by interesting to see vulnerabilities in Bluetooth (4.0) connections, like if keys on a Bluetooth keyboard are securely transmitted to the device its paired with.

title: Works as advertised
comment: Does a great job of showing Bluetooth data.  Very uesful for debugging.

title: fixed a keyboard pairing issue immediately
comment: (I am typing on the keyboard that previoualy failed to pair and connect)

title: Awesome app
comment: Just like Tj Flemings I had an issue connecting to a devise and this allowed me to thank you!!!!

title: Doesn't work
comment: It just shows a red x on the bluetooth symbol and shows no data

This is a general purpose debugging tool. It doesn't work with a lot of devices, because they need a certain protocol or equipment to debug, which is not possible to anticipate without deep knowledge of the target device. It's not possible to make this app work with everything.

title: This app rocks for one reason
comment: This app made it possible to connect my Withing's Pulse with my HTC One X in 5 seconds after spending weeks NOT being able to connect. Download and use this app if you too lost the ability to sync with a recent software update to your Pulse. It'll be months before Withings fixes this, if ever.

I'm glad the app helped :) But I don't really understand your use case, and I'd like to know more. Could you please drop me an email and explain a bit more how this helped with your Withing's Pulse? (I don't know what is that.)

title: Doesn't connect
comment: I've never managed to make this app connect to me Bluetooth headset. It seems to be rather useless.

The app is a debugging tool for programmers, not for regular users.
Some Bluetooth devices require a so-called "handshake" first to initiate the conversation. You will need the programming manual of your Bluetooth headset to figure out the right message to send.
